result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joleen A Reynolds was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $1,275 fine including all applicable Court costs, payable immediately or serve 25 days in the HOC. Bail to be applied

Consecutive to: with Huber privileges for work.
SENTENCE STAYED UNTIL 03-04-2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joleen A Reynolds

Defendant Joleen A Reynolds in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the parties.  
Court sentenced defendant to 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive with 0 days credit, and with huber privileges for work.  (SENTENCE STAYED UNTIL 3-4-2016)
Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1275.00 inclusive of all applicable court costs payable immediately or 25 days in HOC, (CASH BAIL POSTED TO BE APPLIED TOWARDS FINE)
Court ordered defendant's driver's license REVOKED for 16 months.
Court ordered IGNITION INTERLOCK/SEIZURE of defendant's vehicle for a period of 2 years.

AS TO COUNT ONE: 
 Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Defendant Joleen A Reynolds in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia. 
No diriving without a valid drivers license.   
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joleen A Reynolds in court with attorney Rex R. Anderegg.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
